content.location: Northern end of Cap Rocks formation, between Pop Quiz and The Hangout crack.

content.description:
This route is located on Cap Rock, next to Cuticle corner.  Set up a toprope to drop to the left of the dihedral.

Climb the face climbers right of the cuticle corner crack.  Crimps and sidepulls are nice.  A bit contrived - it can be made easier the closer you stay to the corner, if I remember right.
Short 20â€™ route that climbs the central face climbers right of Cuticle Corner
content.protection: Two bolt anchor. Top rope only.
content.location: Bolted anchor on the face left of Cuticle Corner when looking down from the top. This is a separate anchor than the one near the corner used for Cuticle Corner itself and the Uncorner.

content.description: Start on the right-trending thin crack that begins from a block. Thin crack suddenly changes direction, tending left now, leading to a nearly horizontal roof crack (hand/fist). After a few moves, reach over the edge and pull jugs to mantle out.
content.protection: Top-rope seems best. Could potentially lead with gear up to 3"
content.location: Climber's left end of Cap Rocks formation. Right of (across from) Pop Quiz, within the same alcove. Pop Quiz and this roof crack are separated by a wide chimney.

content.description: Slightly overhanging perfect hand crack that.  Super fun route definitely worth setting up top rope if your in the area, would get 4 stars if it weren't so short.  Can also top rope The  Hangout from the same bolts.
content.protection: Two bolts for top rope or hand sized gear
content.location: Looking down from the top this route is on the right side of the cap rocks.  There are two bolts at the top right above a corner with a squeeze chimney.  Rap down, or down climb further right and walk back around to the base.  Pop Quiz is the right slanting hand crack that goes up to the left of the squeeze chimney.

content.description: This climb is a must do at Tollhouse.  The climbing follows the right side of a giant detached flake on the Tollhouse caprock.  It goes from thin to great hands till you gain the top of the flake.  From here a 5.8 face move is made to top out on the caprock.
content.location: Approach by walking up to the top of Tollhouse Rock then looking over the edge to see the prow of the caprock.  The prow has a single crack that runs through it angling down either side of the edge.  The right side crack is Platinum Plus (5.8) while the crack around the left side of the prow is Strawberry Jam (5.10), both finish on the same 5.8 face moves to the top.

content.description: Overhanging hand crack that gets wider towards the top.  Fun and sustained but short.  Can top rope off same anchors as Pop Quiz.
content.protection: Top rope or hand sized gear.
content.location: Crack going up the right side of the corner just right of the squeeze chimney next to Pop Quiz.

content.description:
Dream Analysis is the left most climb at the "Cap Rock" of Tollhouse.

3" Corner
content.location: From the Cap rock walk left down the decent trail to acess the slab below. Hang right, it's the first corner you come too.

content.description:
This route is located on Cap Rock, and is the crack in the right angle dihedral located just left of where the descent trail drops onto the summit rock.

The route climbs an easy finger and hand crack 35-40 feet in the dihedral.
